data.title: FIBA EuroBasket 2022 rosters: Here are the full rosters for all 24 teams
data.meta_description: EuroBasket 2022 will see over 20 NBA players take the floor in addition to a number of stars from international leagues, including a few names that should be familiar to NCAA basketball fans.
data.text:
FIBA EuroBasket 2022 gets underway on Thursday, Sept. 1, as 24 teams governed by FIBA Europe will vie for bragging rights as the best team in the region.

With names like Giannis Antetokounmpo, Luka Doncic and Nikola Jokic representing their respective countries, there will be no shortage of superstar talent, but it doesn't end with them. EuroBasket 2022 will see over 20 other NBA players take the floor in addition to a number of stars from international leagues, including a few names that should be familiar to NCAA basketball fans.

Who is representing which country at EuroBasket 2022? Below, we've got you covered with full rosters from each team that is set to participate. Click to jump to any roster of each of the 24 teams set to play in EuroBasket 2022.

Group A Belgium Bulgaria Georgia Montenegro Spain Turkey Group B Bosnia and Herzegovina France Germany Hungary Lithuania Slovenia Group C Croatia Estonia Great Britain Greece Italy Ukraine Group D Czech Republic Finland Israel Netherlands Poland Serbia

Watch every EuroBasket 2022 game live and on demand with ESPN+. Sign up now to catch all of the action with some of the NBA's biggest stars including Giannis Antetokounmpo, Luka Doncic, Nikola Jokic and more. Stream all games from both the group stage and knockout round from September 1 through the championship on September 18.

Full team rosters for EuroBasket 2022

Active NBA players are listed in bold. Note: free agents like Svi Mykhailiuk and Dennis Schroder are not listed in bold as they are not currently with an NBA team.
